intro: Banisteria enneaptera, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its long, pendulous clusters of yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has compound leaves with numerous small leaflets and produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various soil types. However, it may require regular pruning to maintain its shape and promote healthy growth.
